intro: Phyllocarpa, commonly known as the Australian holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to Australia. The plants are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are often pink or white. Phyllocarpa species typically produce small, fleshy berries that are edible and contain seeds. These plants are adapted to a variety of habitats, including coastal areas and dry forests.
